description: The Elmer Holmes Bobst Library, located at New York University (NYU) in Manhattan, serves as a central hub for academic research and study.
reviews: Bobst Library has been my second home throughout my time at NYU. The building itself is incredible—imagine studying under a 12-story atrium with a stunning geometric ceiling!
Love the atmosphere.
Could use more seating.
The library is a must for anyone serious about studying. You have access to millions of books, digital resources, and archives—everything you’d ever need.
address: 70 Washington Square S, New York, NY 10012

description: The NYU Kimmel Center for University Life, located at 60 Washington Square South, is a 10-story facility on NYU’s Greenwich Village campus. It provides spaces for academic, cultural, and administrative activities, including performance venues, meeting rooms, study areas, and dining facilities.
reviews: Love the vibe here, it's perfect for group study.
Great place to take breaks in between studying. The cafeteria is nearby, which makes it convenient.
There’s a great atmosphere here for collaboration and teamwork.
The lounge areas provide a comfortable space for casual studying and group discussions.
address: 60 Washington Square S, New York, NY 10012

description: Washington Square Park is a public park in the Greenwich Village neighborhood of Lower Manhattan, famous for its arch and vibrant social scene.
reviews: A beautiful park, great for studying or taking a break from the city bustle.
A nice place to relax with friends or alone. I love how it brings people together.
It can get crowded, but it’s still one of the best places to hang out in NYC.
Perfect place to read a book or have a picnic.
address: Washington Square Park, New York, NY 10012

description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, often referred to as 'The Met', is one of the largest and most prestigious art museums in the world.
reviews: A must-visit for any art lover! The museum has a vast collection, and the exhibits are always curated beautifully.
The Met is massive, so make sure to plan your visit well.
I always feel inspired after a visit. The museum’s atmosphere is calming.
It can get crowded, especially on weekends, but it’s totally worth the visit.

description: Brooklyn Bridge Park is a waterfront park along the East River in Brooklyn, offering stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Brooklyn Bridge.
reviews: An amazing spot to take a walk and enjoy views of the skyline and Brooklyn Bridge.
Perfect place for a picnic or to watch the sunset.
I love the vibe here.
One of my favorite places in Brooklyn.

description: Central Park is a large public park in the heart of Manhattan, offering a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.
reviews: I love walking through Central Park in any season.
A great place to escape the city noise.
It can get crowded, but it’s still a relaxing place to unwind.
Central Park is iconic for a reason.
